title: 111_s1603
content: The Act titled "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or "VETS Act of 2009" provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. The "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or "VETS Act of 2009" offers tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service, including refunding tuition when withdrawal is due to service in the uniformed services. The institution must refund tuition and fees to a student who withdraws due to military service, for the period in which academic credit was not received. The institution must refund tuition and fees to a student who withdraws due to military service, for the period in which academic credit was not received. Amounts paid on behalf of the student from scholarships awarded by the institution or funds under this title may be waived. The Secretary will waive student return amounts if withdrawals are due to military service, and loan forgiveness is authorized for withdrawals related to uniformed services. The Secretary will assume the obligation to repay the outstanding principle and accrued interest on any loan assistance for students who did not receive academic credit due to withdrawal. The curr_chunk discusses the calculation of loan assistance awarded to students under part B, minus any amount returned by the institution. The curr_chunk addresses the cancellation of outstanding loan principle and interest for students receiving loan assistance under part D or E. The curr_chunk discusses the calculation of loan assistance for a parent on behalf of a student, taking into account any returned loan assistance by the institution. The curr_chunk discusses reimbursement for cancellation of Perkins loans by the Secretary to institutions based on the aggregate amounts cancelled for each fiscal year. The Secretary reimburses institutions for canceled Perkins loans made from Federal capital contributions to the student loan fund. Funds from section 461(b) are not available for these payments. The Secretary aims to pay qualifying institutions within 3 months of filing. The Secretary reimburses institutions for canceled Perkins loans made from Federal capital contributions to the student loan fund within 3 months of filing an institutional application for campus-based funds. Loan eligibility and limits for students are adjusted if academic credit is not received due to withdrawal. The result of withdrawal due to service in the uniformed services does not affect a student's loan limits or eligibility for grants or loans under this title. The term 'service in the uniformed services' is defined in section 484C(a). The amendments made by this Act will apply to periods of service in the uniformed services starting after the enactment date. A "period of service in the uniformed services" is defined as the time from 30 days before a student is required to report for service until they return from that service.
